channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Car materials o/s 1 Hadley Road on footway, 18th September
item.description:
Lot of noise of cutting the vehicles in parts and obstruction on the public road. The road is full of parts and rubbish which also is spilling out on the pavement. In the last few weeks we had few cars parked on Hadley road with no vehicle registration No, in damaged condition, or untaxed. Currently one car is parked on the front on No 1 Hadley road, with bits hanging off and possibly dangerous for pedestrians- no number plate registration. Another car is parked at the moment next to No 29 Kingswood Avenue, registration HG20 HXR, red Vauxhall, untaxed, believe that belongs to the same business
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hadley Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling, 18th September
item.description:
There is a ridiculous amount of dog poo littering the whole street. I walk my daughter to school and literally have to dodge this on the way to school!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowper Close, Widmore, London

item.title: Plastic waste and general rubbish all over this site, 18th September
item.description:
Plastic waste all over this site blowing about causing environmental damage due to micro plastics. The area looks like it has had fly tipping and the waste has been spread all over the site. Iâ€™m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. Tap to see exactly where it is: ///lamp.keep.funds https://w3w.co/lamp.keep.funds

item.title: Tricorn House lift out of service, 18th September
item.description:

item.title: Reported THREE times and not removrd, 18th September
item.description:
White builders bag full of rotting wood too big for bin opposite 73 Connaught Gardens. I reported it first on FixMyStreet. Not removed. Then I rang up after a week or so and gor another email with another job number. This is the third time. If you donâ€™t actually remove flytipped rubbish why not let me know and Iâ€™ll have to take it to the dump or have a bonfire.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Connaught Gardens, Muswell Hill, London

item.title: No opportunity to pay for parking, 18th September
item.description:
I use the canal and work on narrow boats. This entire estate is permit holders only and makes accessing the canal impossible for visitors. Im having to park up on the high street, and have to return to my vehicle within 4hours. I am happy to pay to park
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mandeville Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The news is overgrown with vegetation, 18th September
item.description:
A tree is growing out of the pavement. There is a path in the mews that can be used as vegetation is over hanging over the walls. When it is cut the residents leave it on the pavement to rot down. The pavement is needed as cars are now using the mews

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Culford Mews, Hackney, London
